Peripheral.Name: Embedded Flash
Peripheral.Description: The Flash memory interface manages AXI accesses to the Flash memory. It implements the erase and program Flash memory operations and the read and write protection mechanisms

Bit.Name: RDP
Bit.Description: Read protection option byte. The read protection is used to protect the software code stored in Flash memory.

Values.Val: Level 0, no protection
or any value other than 0xAA and 0xCC: Level 1, read protection
Level 2, chip protection

Bit.Name: RDP
Bit.Description: Read protection option byte. The read protection is used to protect the software code stored in Flash memory.

Values.Val: Level 0, no protection
or any value other than 0xAA and 0xCC: Level 1, read protection
Level 2, chip protection

Bit.Name: BOR_LEV
Bit.Description: These bits contain the supply level threshold that activates/releases the reset. They can be written to program a new BOR level value into Flash memory

Values.Val: BOR OFF
BOR level1: 2.1V
BOR level2: 2.4 V
BOR level3: 2.7 V

Bit.Name: BOR_LEV
Bit.Description: These bits contain the supply level threshold that activates/releases the reset. They can be written to program a new BOR level value into Flash memory

Values.Val: reset level is set to 0.0 V
reset level is set to 2.1 V
reset level is set to 2.4 V
reset level is set to 2.7 V

Bit.Name: BOOT_CM7_ADD0
Bit.Description: Define the boot address for Cortex-M7 when BOOT0=0

Bit.Name: BOOT_CM7_ADD1
Bit.Description: Define the boot address for Cortex-M7 when BOOT0=1

Bit.Name: PROT_AREA_START
Bit.Description: Flash Bank PCROP start address

Bit.Name: PROT_AREA_END
Bit.Description: Flash Bank PCROP End address (excluded). Deactivation of PCROP can be done by enbaling DMEP1 bit and changing RDP from level 1 to level 0 while putting end address greater than start address.

Values.Val: Flash Bank PCROP zone is kept when RDP level regression (change from level 1 to 0) occurs
Flash Bank PCROP zone is erased when RDP level regression (change from level 1 to 0) occurs

Bit.Name: PROT_AREA_START
Bit.Description: Flash Bank PCROP start address

Bit.Name: PROT_AREA_END
Bit.Description: Flash Bank PCROP End address (excluded). Deactivation of PCROP can be done by enbaling DMEP1 bit and changing RDP from level 1 to level 0 while putting end address greater than start address

Values.Val: Flash Bank PCROP zone is kept when RDP level regression (change from level 1 to 0) occurs
Flash Bank PCROP zone is erased when RDP level regression (change from level 1 to 0) occurs

Bit.Name: SEC_AREA_START1
Bit.Description: Flash Bank 1 secure area start address

Bit.Name: SEC_AREA_END1
Bit.Description: Flash Bank 1 secure area end address. If this address is equal to SEC_AREA_START1, the whole bank 1 is secure protected.If this address is lower than SEC_AREA_START1, no protection is set on bank 1.

Values.Val: Flash Bank 1 secure area is kept when RDP level regression (change from level 1 to 0) occurs
Flash Bank 1 secure area is erased when RDP level regression (change from level 1 to 0) occurs

Bit.Name: SEC_AREA_START1
Bit.Description: Flash Bank 1 secure area start address

Bit.Name: SEC_AREA_END1
Bit.Description: Flash Bank 1 secure area end address. If this address is equal to SEC_AREA_START1, the whole bank 1 is secure protected.If this address is lower than SEC_AREA_START1, no protection is set on bank 1.

Values.Val: Flash Bank 1 secure area is kept when RDP level regression (change from level 1 to 0) occurs
Flash Bank 1 secure area is erased when RDP level regression (change from level 1 to 0) occurs

Bit.Name: SEC_AREA_START2
Bit.Description: Flash Bank 2 secure area start address

Bit.Name: SEC_AREA_END2
Bit.Description: Flash Bank 2 secure area end address. If this address is equal to SEC_AREA_START2, the whole bank 2 is secure protected.If this address is lower than SEC_AREA_START2, no protection is set on bank 2.

Values.Val: Flash Bank 2 secure area is kept when RDP level regression (change from level 1 to 0) occurs
Flash Bank 2 secure area is erased when RDP level regression (change from level 1 to 0) occurs

Bit.Name: SEC_AREA_START2
Bit.Description: Flash Bank 2 secure area start address

Bit.Name: SEC_AREA_END2
Bit.Description: Flash Bank 2 secure area end address. If this address is equal to SEC_AREA_START2, the whole bank 2 is secure protected.If this address is lower than SEC_AREA_START2, no protection is set on bank 2.

Values.Val: Flash Bank 2 secure area is kept when RDP level regression (change from level 1 to 0) occurs
Flash Bank 2 secure area is erased when RDP level regression (change from level 1 to 0) occurs

Bit.Name: nBOOT1
Bit.Description: This bit selects the boot mode only when BOOT0=1. If BOOT0 = 0, boot from system memory when nSWBOOT0=1 and main flash is empty,otherwise, boot from main flash memory.

Values.Val: Boot from embedded SRAM1 when BOOT0=1

SRAM2 parity check enable

Bit.Name: nBOOT0
Bit.Description: This option bit sets the BOOT0 value only when nSWBOOT0=0

Values.Val: BOOT0 = 1, boot memory depends on nBOOT1 value
BOOT0 = 0, boot from system memory when nSWBOOT0=1 and main flash is empty,otherwise, boot from main flash memory

Bit.Description: Flash Bank 1 PCROP start address

Bit.Name: PROT_AREA_END1
Bit.Description: Flash Bank 1 PCROP End address (excluded). Deactivation of PCROP can be done by enbaling DMEP1 bit and changing RDP from level 1 to level 0 while putting end address greater than start address.

Bit.Description: Flash Bank 1 secure area start address

Bit.Name: SEC_AREA_END1
Bit.Description: Flash Bank 1 secure area end address. If this address is equal to SEC_AREA_START1, the whole bank 1 is secure protected.If this address is lower than SEC_AREA_START1, no protection is set on bank 1.

Flash Bank 1 secure area is erased when RDP level regression (change from level 1 to 0) occurs

Flash Bank 1 secure area is erased when RDP level regression (change from level 1 to 0) occurs

Bit.Name: BOOT_CM7_ADD0
Bit.Description: Define the boot address for Cortex-M7 when BOOT0=0

Bit.Name: BOOT_CM7_ADD1
Bit.Description: Define the boot address for Cortex-M7 when BOOT0=1

Bit.Name: PROT_AREA_START1
Bit.Description: Flash Bank 1 PCROP start address

Bit.Name: PROT_AREA_END1
Bit.Description: Flash Bank 1 PCROP End address (excluded). Deactivation of PCROP can be done by enbaling DMEP1 bit and changing RDP from level 1 to level 0 while putting end address greater than start address.

Values.Val: Flash Bank 1 PCROP zone is kept when RDP level regression (change from level 1 to 0) occurs
Flash Bank 1 PCROP zone is erased when RDP level regression (change from level 1 to 0) occurs

Bit.Name: PROT_AREA_START1
Bit.Description: Flash Bank 1 PCROP start address

Bit.Name: PROT_AREA_END1
Bit.Description: Flash Bank 1 PCROP End address (excluded). Deactivation of PCROP can be done by enbaling DMEP1 bit and changing RDP from level 1 to level 0 while putting end address greater than start address

Values.Val: Flash Bank 1 PCROP zone is kept when RDP level regression (change from level 1 to 0) occurs
Flash Bank 1 PCROP zone is erased when RDP level regression (change from level 1 to 0) occurs

Bit.Name: PROT_AREA_START2
Bit.Description: Flash Bank 2 PCROP start address

Bit.Name: PROT_AREA_END2
Bit.Description: Flash Bank 2 PCROP End address. Deactivation of PCROP can be done by enbaling DMEP2 bit and changing RDP from level 1 to level 0 while putting end address greater than start address

Values.Val: Flash Bank 2 PCROP zone is kept when RDP level regression (change from level 1 to 0) occurs
Flash Bank 2 PCROP zone is erased when RDP level regression (change from level 1 to 0) occurs

Bit.Name: PROT_AREA_START2
Bit.Description: Flash Bank 2 PCROP start address

Bit.Name: PROT_AREA_END2
Bit.Description: Flash Bank 2 PCROP End address (excluded). Deactivation of PCROP can be done by enbaling DMEP2 bit and changing RDP from level 1 to level 0 while putting end address greater than start address

Values.Val: Flash Bank 2 PCROP zone is kept when RDP level regression (change from level 1 to 0) occurs
Flash Bank 2 PCROP zone is erased when RDP level regression (change from level 1 to 0) occurs

Bit.Name: SEC_AREA_START1
Bit.Description: Flash Bank 1 secure area start address

Bit.Name: SEC_AREA_END1
Bit.Description: Flash Bank 1 secure area end address. If this address is equal to SEC_AREA_START1, the whole bank 1 is secure protected.If this address is lower than SEC_AREA_START1, no protection is set on bank 1.

Values.Val: Flash Bank 1 secure area is kept when RDP level regression (change from level 1 to 0) occurs
Flash Bank 1 secure area is erased when RDP level regression (change from level 1 to 0) occurs

Bit.Name: SEC_AREA_START1
Bit.Description: Flash Bank 1 secure area start address

Bit.Name: SEC_AREA_END1
Bit.Description: Flash Bank 1 secure area end address. If this address is equal to SEC_AREA_START1, the whole bank 1 is secure protected.If this address is lower than SEC_AREA_START1, no protection is set on bank 1.

Values.Val: Flash Bank 1 secure area is kept when RDP level regression (change from level 1 to 0) occurs
Flash Bank 1 secure area is erased when RDP level regression (change from level 1 to 0) occurs

Bit.Name: SEC_AREA_START2
Bit.Description: Flash Bank 2 secure area start address

Bit.Name: SEC_AREA_END2
Bit.Description: Flash Bank 2 secure area end address. If this address is equal to SEC_AREA_START2, the whole bank 2 is secure protected.If this address is lower than SEC_AREA_START2, no protection is set on bank 2.

Values.Val: Flash Bank 2 secure area is kept when RDP level regression (change from level 1 to 0) occurs
Flash Bank 2 secure area is erased when RDP level regression (change from level 1 to 0) occurs

Bit.Name: SEC_AREA_START2
Bit.Description: Flash Bank 2 secure area start address

Bit.Name: SEC_AREA_END2
Bit.Description: Flash Bank 2 secure area end address. If this address is equal to SEC_AREA_START2, the whole bank 2 is secure protected.If this address is lower than SEC_AREA_START2, no protection is set on bank 2.

Values.Val: Flash Bank 2 secure area is kept when RDP level regression (change from level 1 to 0) occurs
Flash Bank 2 secure area is erased when RDP level regression (change from level 1 to 0) occurs

Bit.Name: RDP
Bit.Description: Read protection option byte. The read protection is used to protect the software code stored in Flash memory.

Values.Val: Level 0, no protection
or any value other than 0xAA and 0xCC: Level 1, read protection
Level 2, chip protection

Bit.Name: BOR_LEV
Bit.Description: These bits contain the supply level threshold that activates/releases the reset. They can be written to program a new BOR level value into Flash memory

Values.Val: BOR Level 0, reset level threshold is around 1.7 V
BOR Level 1, reset level threshold is around 2.0 V
BOR Level 2, reset level threshold is around 2.2 V
BOR Level 3, reset level threshold is around 2.5 V
BOR Level 4, reset level threshold is around 2.8 V
Reset generated when entering Stop mode

Bit.Name: DB1M
Bit.Description: Dual-Bank on 1 MB Flash or 512 KB Flash memory devices

Values.Val: 1 MB or 512 Kb single Flash: contiguous address in bank1
1 MB or 512 Kb dual-bank Flash with contiguous addresses. When DB1M is set, a hard Fault is generated when the requested address goes over 1 MB or 512 Kb.

Bit.Name: DBANK
Bit.Description: This bit can only be written when PCROPA/B is disabled

Values.Val: Single bank mode with 128 bits data read width
Dual bank mode with 64 bits data

Bit.Name: nBOOT1
Bit.Description: This bit selects the boot mode only when BOOT0=1. If BOOT0 = 0, boot from system memory when nSWBOOT0=1 and main flash is empty,otherwise, boot from main flash memory.

Values.Val: Boot from embedded SRAM1 when BOOT0=1
Boot from system memory when BOOT0=1

Bit.Name: SRAM2_PE
Bit.Description: SRAM2 parity check enable

Values.Val: SRAM2 parity check enable
SRAM2 parity check disable

Bit.Name: SRAM2_RST
Bit.Description: SRAM2 Erase when system reset

Values.Val: SRAM2 erased when a system reset occurs
SRAM2 is not erased when a system reset occurs

Bit.Name: nSWBOOT0
Bit.Description: Software BOOT0

Values.Val: BOOT0 taken from the option bit nBOOT0
BOOT0 taken from PH3/BOOT0 pin

Bit.Name: nBOOT0
Bit.Description: This option bit sets the BOOT0 value only when nSWBOOT0=0

Values.Val: BOOT0 = 1, boot memory depends on nBOOT1 value
BOOT0 = 0, boot from system memory when nSWBOOT0=1 and main flash is empty,otherwise, boot from main flash memory

Bit.Description: Internal reset holder enable bit

Bit.Name: PCROP1A_STRT
Bit.Description: Flash Bank 1 PCROP start address

Bit.Name: PCROP1A_END
Bit.Description: Flash Bank 1 PCROP End address(excluded). Deactivation of PCROP can be done by enabling PCROP_RDP and changing RDP from level 1 to level 0

Values.Val: PCROP zone is kept when RDP is decreased
PCROP zone is erased when RDP is decreased

Bit.Name: PCROP1B_STRT
Bit.Description: Flash Bank 1 PCROP start address

Bit.Name: PCROP1B_END
Bit.Description: Flash Bank 1 PCROP End address(excluded). Deactivation of PCROP can be done by enabling PCROP_RDP and changing RDP from level 1 to level 0

Bit.Name: WRP1A_STRT
Bit.Description: The address of the first page of the Bank 1 WRP first area

Bit.Description: The address of the last page of the Bank 1 WRP first area

Bit.Name: WRP1B_STRT
Bit.Description: The address of the first page of the Bank 1 WRP second area

Bit.Name: WRP1B_END
Bit.Description: The address of the last page of the Bank 1 WRP second area

Bit.Name: BOOT_LOCK
Bit.Description: used to force boot from user area

Values.Val: Boot based on the pad/option bit configuration
Boot forced from Main Flash memory

Bit.Name: SEC_SIZE
Bit.Description: Securable memory area size

Device.Name: STM32MPxxx
Device.Description: ARM 32-bit Cortex-A7 and ARM 32-bit Cortex-M4 dualprocessor based device, CPU clock up to 600MHz

Bit.Name: none
Bit.Description: none

Bit.Name: TR
Bit.Description: set SAFMEM Ring current level, default value = 0b00

Bit.Name: PRGWIDTH
Bit.Description: SAFMEM Programming Pulse Width, default value = 0b0001

Bit.Name: FRC
Bit.Description: SAFMEM CLOCK frequency range selection, default value = 0b11

Bit.Name: PWRUP
Bit.Description: SAFMEM Power up control

Bit.Name: BIST2LOCK
Bit.Description: 0: BIST2 is not locked, 1: BIST2 is locked.

Bit.Name: BIST1LOCK
Bit.Description: 0: BIST1 is not locked, 1: BIST1 is locked.

Bit.Name: PWRON
Bit.Description: 0: SAFMEM is in Power Off, 1: SAFMEM is in Power On.

Bit.Name: PROGFAIL
Bit.Description: 0: SAFMEM last programming was successful, 1: SAFMEM last programming failed.

Bit.Name: BUSY
Bit.Description: 0: SAFMEM is Idle, 1: SAFMEM operation is on going.

Bit.Name: INVALID
Bit.Description: 0: OTP mode is not OTP-INVALID, 1: OTP mode is OTP-INVALID.

Bit.Name: FULLDBG
Bit.Description: 0: OTP mode is OTP-OPEN1, 1: OTP mode is OTP-OPEN2.

Bit.Name: SECURE
Bit.Description: 0: OTP mode is not OTP-SECURED, 1: OTP mode is OTP-SECURED.

Bit.Name: GPLOCK
Bit.Description: 0: SAFMEM Programming is allowed, 1: SAFMEM Programming is disabled until next sytem reste.

Bit.Name: FENREG
Bit.Description: 0: BSEC_FENABLE register is not Locked, 1: BSEC_FENABLE register is Locked until the next System-Reset.

Bit.Name: DENREG
Bit.Description: 0: BSEC_DENABLE register is not Locked, 1: BSEC_DENABLE register is Locked until the next System-Reset.

Bit.Name: OTP
Bit.Description: 0: upper OTP region access is not locked, 1: upper OTP region access is Locked until the next System-Reset, when locked, the upper region OTP can not be R out from SAFMEM.

Bit.Name: DBGSWENABLE
Bit.Description: Control Self Hosted Debug enable with signal dbgswenable. 0: memory-mapped accesses to all ETM registers are disabled and return Error, 1: no effect on external debugger accesses.

Bit.Name: CFGSDISABLE
Bit.Description: Write access to secure GIC registers disable with signal: cfgsdisable. 0: no effect, all GIC registers can be accessed, 1: Disable write access to some Secure GIC registers.

Bit.Name: CP15SDISABLE
Bit.Description: Write access to some secure Cortex-A7 CP15 registers is disabled for CPUx. 0: All CP15 registers can be accessed, 1: Disable write access to some Secure CP15 registers into Cortex-A7 corresponding CPU.

Bit.Name: SPNIDEN
Bit.Description: Secure Privilege Non Invasive Debug enable with signal spiden. 0: Secure Privilege Non Invasive Debug Disabled, 1: Secure Privilege Non Invasive Debug Enabled.

Bit.Name: SPIDEN
Bit.Description: Secure Privilege Invasive Debug enable with signal spniden. 0: Secure Privilege Invasive Debug Disabled, 1: Secure Privilege Invasive Debug Enabled.

Bit.Name: HDPEN
Bit.Description: Hardware Debug Port enable with signal hdpen. 0: Hardware Debug Port Disabled, 1: Hardware Debug Port Enabled.

Bit.Name: DEVICEEN
Bit.Description: Controls the access to Debug component via external debug port by signal deviceen. 0: Disabled, 1: Enabled.

Bit.Name: NIDEN
Bit.Description: Non Invasive Debug enable with signal niden. 0: Non Invasive Debug Disabled, 1: Non Invasive Debug Enabled.

Bit.Name: DBGEN
Bit.Description: Debug enable with signal dbgen. 0: Disabled, 1: Enabled.

Bit.Name: DFTEN
Bit.Description: DFT enable with signal dften. 0: DFT Disabled, 1: DFT Enabled.

Bit.Name: CAN_disable
Bit.Description: 0: CAN interface is enabled, 1: CAN interface is disabled.

Bit.Name: GPU_disable
Bit.Description: 0: GPU enabled, 1: GPU disabled.

Bit.Name: Dual_A7_disable
Bit.Description: 0: Cortex A7 Dual CPU, 1: Cortex A7 Single CPU.

Bit.Name: Crypto_disable
Bit.Description: 0: All crypto HW accelerators are enabled(default), 1: All crypto HW accelerators are disabled for export license control.

Bit.Name: W_R conf
Bit.Description: This Bit determins weither the OTP file will be written in BSEC or programmed in SAFMEM

Bit.Name: BSEC_OTP_DISTURBED0
Bit.Description: If the Bit is set to 1 that means that the last Ring of the corresponding word has been disturbed; abnormal Ring conditions in decoding circuitry and Ring voltages have been detected

Bit.Name: BSEC_OTP_DISTURBED1
Bit.Description: If the Bit is set to 1 that means that the last Ring of the corresponding word has been disturbed; abnormal Ring conditions in decoding circuitry and Ring voltages have been detected

Bit.Name: BSEC_OTP_DISTURBED2
Bit.Description: If the Bit is set to 1 that means that the last Ring of the corresponding word has been disturbed; abnormal Ring conditions in decoding circuitry and Ring voltages have been detected

Bit.Name: BSEC_OTP_ERROR0
Bit.Description: If the Bit is set to 1 that means that the last R operation of the word concerned has revealed a redundancy or ECC check error.

Bit.Name: BSEC_OTP_ERROR1
Bit.Description: If the Bit is set to 1 that means that the last R operation of the word concerned has revealed a redundancy or ECC check error.

Bit.Name: BSEC_OTP_ERROR2
Bit.Description: If the Bit is set to 1 that means that the last R operation of the word concerned has revealed a redundancy or ECC check error.

Bit.Name: BSEC_OTP_WRLOCK0
Bit.Description: If the Bit is set to 1 that means that the correspanding OTP word is under programming permenant lock.

Bit.Name: BSEC_OTP_WRLOCK1
Bit.Description: If the Bit is set to 1 that means that the correspanding OTP word is under programming permenant lock.

Bit.Name: BSEC_OTP_WRLOCK2
Bit.Description: If the Bit is set to 1 that means that the correspanding OTP word is under programming permenant lock.

Bit.Name: BSEC_OTP_SPLOCK0
Bit.Description: If the Bit is set to 1 that means that the correspanding OTP word is under programming sticky lock until next system-reset

Bit.Name: BSEC_OTP_SPLOCK1
Bit.Description: If the Bit is set to 1 that means that the correspanding OTP word is under programming sticky lock until next system-reset

Bit.Name: BSEC_OTP_SPLOCK2
Bit.Description: If the Bit is set to 1 that means that the correspanding OTP word is under programming sticky lock until next system-reset

Bit.Name: BSEC_OTP_SWLOCK0
Bit.Description: If the Bit is set to 1 that means that any attempt to write to the correspanding OTP shadow register will be prevented until next system-reset

Bit.Name: BSEC_OTP_SWLOCK1
Bit.Description: If the Bit is set to 1 that means that any attempt to write to the correspanding OTP shadow register will be prevented until next system-reset

Bit.Name: BSEC_OTP_SWLOCK2
Bit.Description: If the Bit is set to 1 that means that any attempt to write to the correspanding OTP shadow register will be prevented until next system-reset

Bit.Name: BSEC_OTP_SRLOCK0
Bit.Description: If the Bit is set to 1 that means that any attempt to reload to the correspanding OTP shadow register will be prevented until next system-reset. Instead a R command, shall clear the shadow register

Bit.Name: BSEC_OTP_SRLOCK1
Bit.Description: If the Bit is set to 1 that means that any attempt to reload to the correspanding OTP shadow register will be prevented until next system-reset. Instead a R command, shall clear the shadow register

Bit.Name: BSEC_OTP_SRLOCK2
Bit.Description: If the Bit is set to 1 that means that any attempt to reload to the correspanding OTP shadow register will be prevented until next system-reset. Instead a R command, shall clear the shadow register
